items.description:
The Deployment Validation Operator has detected workloads that use
PodDisruptionBudgets that always prevent disruptions. These workloads
will impact your cluster's quality of service, including delays during upgrades.
Red Hat may override the PodDisruptionBudgets and terminate the workloads in
certain cases.

Specific examples of impact:

* The workloads will be evicted forcefully during cluster upgrades after
  a configurable grace period.

* Node maintenance operations will be delayed or blocked, possibly preventing
  Red Hat from maintaining cluster stability.

* Cluster autoscaler will be unable to drain and remove under-utilized nodes.

Kube-linter checks:


* [pdb-max-unavailable](https://github.com/stackrox/kube-linter/blob/main/docs/generated/checks.md#pdb-max-unavailable)
* [pdb-min-available](https://github.com/stackrox/kube-linter/blob/main/docs/generated/checks.md#pdb-min-available)


[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.dvo.pdbs_prevent_disruptions|DVO_PDBS_PREVENT_DISRUPTIONS_OSD).
items.summary: Red Hat's ability to manage an OSD cluster is limited when workloads use pod disruption budgets that prevent any disruptions

items.description:
The Deployment Validation Operator has detected workloads that do not specify container memory requests and limits. The cluster needs these hints to spread load across nodes evenly and to prevent malfunctioning containers from affecting all workloads on a node.

Kube-linter check: [unset-memory-requirements](https://github.com/stackrox/kube-linter/blob/main/docs/generated/checks.md#unset-memory-requirements)


[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.dvo.unset_memory_requirements|DVO_UNSET_MEMORY_REQUIREMENTS).
items.summary: The cluster cannot spread load across nodes evenly when workloads do not specify container memory requests and limits

items.description:
The `image.config.openshift.io/cluster` object specifies a ConfigMap
`image-registry-ca` for additional trusted CAs but the ConfigMap does
not exist in the `openshift-config` namespace. The cluster cannot use images
from image registries that require additional trusted CAs.

Also, the Image Registry Operator is degraded which impacts the cluster's
ability to upgrade.



[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.rules.image_registry_missing_ca_configmap|IMAGE_REGISTRY_MISSING_CA_CONFIGMAP).
items.summary: Image registries are not available when a ConfigMap with required trusted CA certificates is missing

items.description:
The cluster is running OpenShift Container Platform 4.11.5. In OpenShift Container Platform 4.11, the CRI-O has deprecated the pids-limits and log-size-max options because they are duplicated with the configuration in the kubelet.

- Setting the PIDs limit in the ContainerRuntimeConfig is expected to be deprecated. If PIDs limits are required, it is recommended to use the podPidsLimit field in the KubeletConfig CR instead. The default value of the podPidsLimit field is 4096.



[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.rules.deprecating_support_for_cri_o_parameters|DEPRECATING_SUPPORT_FOR_CRI_O_PARAMETERS).
items.summary: Setting pidsLimit and logSizeMax in ContainerRuntimeConfig CRs is expected to be deprecated

items.description:
The cost management service is running on this ROSA cluster.
The authentication type of the cost management service is set to **token** in `costmanagementmetricscfg-sample-v1beta1`. Because
the `console.redhat.com` token is not defined for ROSA clusters,
the authentication fails when using cluster token for authentication. This further leads to
the cost management operator failing to upload data to `console.redhat.com`.


[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.rules.cmmc_auth_fail_due_to_token_undefined|CMMC_AUTH_FAIL_DUE_TO_TOKEN_UNDEFINED).
items.summary: The cost management service fails to upload data to console.redhat.com when configured to use a token for authentication

items.description:
The cluster operator operator-lifecycle-manager-packageserver is unavailable when its certificate has expired. Due to a known bug in OpenShift 4.15.18, the certificate relating to operator-lifecycle-manager-packageserver didn't rotate after it expired. The cluster operator operator-lifecycle-manager-packageserver became unavailable. The detailed error message is:
  - ClusterServiceVersion openshift-operator-lifecycle-manager/packageserver observed in phase Failed with reason: APIServiceResourceIssue, message: found the serving cert not active


[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.rules.olm_packageserver_certificate_expired|OLM_PACKAGESERVER_CERTIFICATE_EXPIRED).
items.summary: The cluster operator operator-lifecycle-manager-packageserver is unavailable when its certificate has expired

items.description:
The Deployment Validation Operator has detected workloads that are not selected by any
NetworkPolicy. Network access to such workloads is unrestricted which makes them prone to security breaches.
It is a best practice to create NetworkPolicy resources to explicitly define the minimal required network access for each workload.

Kube-linter check: [non-isolated-pod](https://github.com/stackrox/kube-linter/blob/main/docs/generated/checks.md#non-isolated-pod)


[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.dvo.non_isolated_pod|DVO_NON_ISOLATED_POD).
items.summary: Workloads are prone to security breaches when no NetworkPolicy matches them

items.description:
Workloads/tools are still using the following deprecated APIs.


APIs in use that will be removed in the next release:

- **customresourcedefinitions [apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1]**

- **ingresses [extensions/v1beta1]**




APIs in use that will be removed in the next EUS release:

- **customresourcedefinitions [apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1]**

- **ingresses [extensions/v1beta1]**



The following prometheus alerts are firing because of this issue.

- **APIRemovedInNextEUSReleaseInUse**

- **APIRemovedInNextReleaseInUse**




[More details](https://console.redhat.com/openshift/insights/advisor/recommendations/ccx_rules_ocp.external.rules.api_removed_in_next_release_in_use|API_REMOVED_IN_NEXT_RELEASE_IN_USE).
items.summary: Workloads are still using the deprecated APIs which will be removed in the next release
